subject: Science
title: Sea and Land Breezes
description: A micro-lesson that makes Sea and Land Breezes usable.

hook.text: If you've been to a beach, you know the breeze shifts between day and night.

buildup.text: During the day, land heats faster than water. Hot air over land rises.

discovery.text: Cooler air from the sea rushes in to fill the gap â€” that's the sea breeze.

twist.text: At night, the pattern reverses. Land cools faster, so air flows from land to sea.

climax.text: This simple heating difference creates a daily wind cycle along every coastline.

punchline.text: The beach breeze in your face is just physics keeping score.

quiz.question: Why does a sea breeze blow from ocean to land during the day?
options: Land heats faster, causing air to rise
The Moon pulls air toward shore
